definition[0]: used to say that someone or something moves to a position on a surface, area, or object
example[0]: She watched him walk onto the platform.
example[1]: Don’t jump onto  (=into) the bus while it’s moving.
example[2]: Pour the syrup on to the egg mixture.
example[3]: The car rolled over onto its side.
example[4]: Let’s get back onto the highway.
definition[1]: used to say that a room, door, or window faces towards something or allows movement into another place
example[5]: The dining room looks out onto a pretty garden.
example[6]: a gate leading on to a broad track
